intro: Daphne hanalei, commonly known as the Hawaiian daphne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Daphne hanalei is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beautiful blooms.
